[[File:James Ridolfo 12 April 1966.jpg|thumb]] On [[12 April]] [[1966]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to James Ridolfo'''.{{webcite|author=[[Pieter Collier]]|articleurl=http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/press/979-30_years_Letters_of_JRR_Tolkien.php|articlename=Something to celebrate: 30 years The Letters of J. R. R. Tolkien|dated=21 January 2011|website=TL|accessed=17 July 2012}} *'''Subject:''' A stock reply to a letter of appreciation, to which Tolkien added: "best wishes! JRR Tolkien". *'''Publication:''' None. == Transcript == {{blockquote|Dear Sergeant Ridolfo,
Thank you very much for your kind letter. I am always pleased to hear from people who have read and enjoyed my books. I hope they will continue to give you pleasure.
Best wishes!
J.R.R. Tolkien}} {{References}} [[Category:Letters|Ridolfo, James]]
